Music

Albums | EPs | Singles | Remixes | Guest Appearances | Mixes

ALBUMS
Plastic Beach

Release date: 3rd March 2010

Formats: Digital / CD / 12″ Vinyl / 12″ Vinyl (Red) / 12″ Vinyl (Picture Disc)

Where to listen: https://gorillaz.lnk.to/PlasticBeach

The third studio album.

Tracklist:

Orchestral Intro [feat. sinfonia ViVA]
Welcome to the World of the Plastic Beach [feat. Snoop Dogg & Hypnotic Brass Ensemble]
White Flag [feat. Bashy, Kano & the National Orchestra for Arabic Music]
Rhinestone Eyes
Stylo [feat. Mos Def & Bobby Womack]
Superfast Jellyfish [feat. Gruff Rhys & De La Soul]
Empire Ants [feat. Little Dragon]
Glitter Freeze [feat. Mark E. Smith]
Some Kind of Nature [feat. Lou Reed]
On Melancholy Hill
Broken
Sweepstakes [feat. Mos Def & Hypnotic Brass Ensemble]
Plastic Beach [feat. Mick Jones & Paul Simonon]
To Binge [feat. Little Dragon]
Cloud of Unknowing [feat. Bobby Womack & sinfonia ViVA]
Pirate Jet
The Fall

Release dates:

Sub Division: 25th December 2010
Standard: 18th April 2011

Formats: Digital / CD / 12″ Vinyl / 12″ Vinyl (Forest Green Translucent)

Where to listen: https://gorillaz.lnk.to/TheFall

The fourth studio album. It was originally given to Sub Division members for free as a Christmas present. The album was recorded entirely on Damon Albarn’s iPad during the American leg of the Escape to Plastic Beach World Tour; and was released commercially four months later.

Tracklist:

Phoner To Arizona
Revolving Doors
Hillbilly Man
Detroit
Shy-town
Little Pink Plastic Bags
The Joplin Spider
The Parish of Space Dust
The Snake in Dallas
Amarillo
The Speak It Mountains
Aspen Forest
Bobby In Phoenix [feat. Bobby Womack]
California And The Slipping Of The Sun
Seattle Yodel [feat. the Archie McPhee Yodelling Pickle]
The Singles Collection 2001-2011

Release date: 28th November 2011

Formats: Digital / CD / 12″ Vinyl / 7″ Vinyl

The third compilation album, collecting almost every single from the band’s career (up until this point); in celebration of their tenth anniversary.

Tracklist:

Tomorrow Comes Today
Clint Eastwood [with Del]
19-2000
Rock the House [with Del]
Feel Good Inc. [feat. De La Soul]
DARE (Radio Edit) [feat. Shaun Ryder]
Dirty Harry [feat. Bootie Brown]
Kids with Guns
El Mañana
Stylo (Radio Edit) [feat. Mos Def & Bobby Womack]
Superfast Jellyfish [feat. Gruff Rhys & De La Soul]
On Melancholy Hill (Radio Edit)
Doncamatic [feat. Daley]
Clint Eastwood (Ed Case/Sweetie Irie Refix – Edit)
19-2000 (Soulchild Remix)
EPs
iTunes Session

Release date: 22nd October 2010

Formats: Digital

Where to listen: https://music.apple.com/us/album/itunes-session/693778034

Released only in the US as part of Apple’s iTunes Session series, this EP contains eight live renditions of tracks from the first three studio albums; alongside an exclusive interview with Murdoc & 2D.

Tracklist:

Clint Eastwood (iTunes Session)
Dirty Harry (iTunes Session)
Feel Good Inc (iTunes Session)
Kids With Guns (iTunes Session)
Stylo (iTunes Session)
Glitter Freeze (iTunes Session)
On Melancholy Hill (iTunes Session)
Rhinestone Eyes (iTunes Session)
iTunes Interview
SINGLES
Stylo [feat. Mos Def & Bobby Womack]

Release date: 26th January 2010

Formats: Digital / CD (Promo)

The first single from Plastic Beach.

B-Sides:

Stylo (Radio Edit) [feat. Mos Def & Bobby Womack]
Stylo (Instrumental)
Superfast Jellyfish [feat. Gruff Rhys & De La Soul]

Release date: 28th May 2010

Formats: CD (Promo)

The second single from Plastic Beach. Despite being a major single, it had no commercial release.

Tracklist:

Superfast Jellyfish [feat. Gruff Rhys & De La Soul]
Superfast Jellyfish (Instrumental)
On Melancholy Hill

Release date: 12th June 2010

Formats: Digital / CD (Promo)

Where to listen: https://music.apple.com/us/album/on-melancholy-hill-ep/717397429

The third and final single from Plastic Beach.

B-Sides:

On Melancholy Hill (Radio Edit)
On Melancholy Hill (Instrumental)
On Melancholy Hill (Japanese Popstars Remix – Edit)
On Melancholy Hill (She Is Danger Remix)
Stylo (Labrinth SNES Remix) [feat. Tinie Tempah]
Doncamatic [feat. Daley]

Release date: 22nd November 2010

Formats: Digital / CD / 7″ Vinyl (Picture Disc)

A non-album single.

B-sides:

Doncamatic (The Joker Remix) [feat. Daley]
Album Mix Tape*
Empire Ants (Paul Harris & Paul Rogers Vocal Mix – Edit) [feat. Little Dragon]

*A mixtape of tracks from Plastic Beach.

Revolving Doors / Amarillo

Release date: 14th March 2011

Formats: Digital / CD (Promo)

A double A-side release; the only single from The Fall.

DoYaThing [feat. André 3000 & James Murphy]

Release date: 23rd February 2012

Formats: Digital / 10″ Vinyl (Single-Sided)

Where to listen: https://soundcloud.com/doyathing/doyathing-full-version

A non-album single that was part of Converse’s 3 Artists, 1 Song series; as a tie-in with the Gorillaz line of Chuck Taylor All-Stars. This is the longest Gorillaz song to date; and was their final song before the hiatus.

White Flag [feat. Bashy, Kano & the National Orchestra for Arabic Music]

Release date: 17th April 2010

Formats: 10″ Vinyl

This release isn’t classed as a major single; it was made for Record Store Day 2010 and limited to 1000 copies.

Tracklist:

Side A –
White Flag [feat. Bashy, Kano & the National Orchestra for Arabic Music]
Side B –
Pirate’s Progress
Rhinestone Eyes

Release date: June 2010

Formats: CD (Promo)

This was intended to be the fourth single from Plastic Beach, but was scrapped; leaving only promotional copies for radio that were never used.

Tracklist:

Rhinestone Eyes
Rhinestone Eyes (Instrumental)

Release date: 2nd March 2010

Formats: Digital

Superfast Jellyfish (Mighty Mouse Remix)

Release date: 13th April 2010

Formats: Digital

Superfast Jellyfish (Unicorn Kid Remix)

Release date: 13th April 2010

Formats: Digital

On Melancholy Hill (AN21 & Max Vangeli Remix)

Release date: 28th July 2010

Formats: Digital

The Vampire Diaries (Original Television Soundtrack)

Release date: 19th November 2010

Formats: Digital / CD

A remix of On Melancholy Hill by Feed Me.

Track: 15. On Melancholy Hill (Feed Me Remix)

Rhinestone Eyes (Boemklatsch Remix)

Release date: 15th April 2011

Formats: Digital

GUEST APPEARANCES
Snoop Dogg – Doggumentary

Release date: 29th March 2011

Formats: Digital / CD

A track by Snoop Dogg that was produced by and features Gorillaz.

Track: 16. Sumthin Like This Night [feat. Gorillaz]

MIXES
Avenue L – Gorillaz: 10th Anniversary Mix

Release date: 25th November 2011

Formats: Digital
